title: Comments
text: Now we are going to talk about comments Like in real life, there are some comments that we have passed on to someone which means we have said something to someone Similarly, apart from code, if we have to say something in the program then we use comments for that Generally, comments are used to tell about any piece of code or program that what we want to do For example, I have made a variable here Age is equal to 25 So if I want to add any English or any other remark along with this So I can use comments for that There are two types of comments First is single line comment For that, we use double slash So we have put two slashes After that, comments are generally highlighted in green After that, whatever we write, our compiler will ignore it Like this is a variable What did I do? I wrote an English line This is a variable But our compiler will completely ignore this English line Compiler ignores all comments We will save it And if I execute it, then there will be no error in this code There was no output and no error in this code So this is my comment So we can add single line comments anywhere in our code Generally, we add comments so that we can tell what we are going to write in our code And the second type of comments are multi-line comments Like if I write here This is a multi-line comment So what happened? This is an English line So we will get an error in this Because this is not aligned with the syntax of C++ But if I want to make it a multi-line comment Then I can simply write slash After that, star And to end, star and again slash So what happened? A multi-line comment has been created which is inside multiple lines And my compiler will completely ignore this too So there are two types of comments One in single line and one in multi-line Now we also have a shortcut to create comments So the shortcut in VS Code First, let's remove it That is command and slash Like we select all the areas and do command slash They will automatically convert into a comment And if we want, we can also undo So they will be removed from the comment And there is one more thing about comments Like for example, if I do cout here My age And l So let's suppose this is my code And I don't want to execute this code I want the compiler to ignore this code So by selecting this, I can convert it into a comment As soon as I make this code a comment Similarly, nothing will be executed If we save this code And run it, then I won't get any output print Because I have commented out this line

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Now we are going to talk about comments

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Like in real life, there are some comments that we have passed on to someone

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: which means we have said something to someone

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Similarly, apart from code, if we have to say something in the program

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: then we use comments for that

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Generally, comments are used to tell about any piece of code or program

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: that what we want to do

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: For example, I have made a variable here

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Age is equal to 25

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So if I want to add any English or any other remark along with this

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So I can use comments for that

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: There are two types of comments

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: First is single line comment

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: For that, we use double slash

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So we have put two slashes

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: After that, comments are generally highlighted in green

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: After that, whatever we write, our compiler will ignore it

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Like this is a variable

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: What did I do? I wrote an English line

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: This is a variable

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: But our compiler will completely ignore this English line

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Compiler ignores all comments

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: We will save it

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And if I execute it, then there will be no error in this code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: There was no output and no error in this code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So this is my comment

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So we can add single line comments anywhere in our code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Generally, we add comments so that we can tell what we are going to write in our code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And the second type of comments are multi-line comments

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Like if I write here

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: This is a multi-line comment

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So what happened?

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: This is an English line

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So we will get an error in this

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Because this is not aligned with the syntax of C++

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: But if I want to make it a multi-line comment

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Then I can simply write slash

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: After that, star

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And to end, star and again slash

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So what happened?

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: A multi-line comment has been created which is inside multiple lines

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And my compiler will completely ignore this too

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So there are two types of comments

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: One in single line and one in multi-line

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Now we also have a shortcut to create comments

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So the shortcut in VS Code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: First, let's remove it

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: That is command and slash

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Like we select all the areas and do command slash

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: They will automatically convert into a comment

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And if we want, we can also undo

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So they will be removed from the comment

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And there is one more thing about comments

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Like for example, if I do cout here

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: My age

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And l

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So let's suppose this is my code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And I don't want to execute this code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: I want the compiler to ignore this code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: So by selecting this, I can convert it into a comment

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: As soon as I make this code a comment

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Similarly, nothing will be executed

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: If we save this code

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: And run it, then I won't get any output print

chunks.title: Comments
chunks.text: Because I have commented out this line
